review: First off, let me say that I am glad I bought the Amazon Fire TV and think it is a good investment. The picture/sound quality is unmatched compared to similar devices. The remote works amazingly and the device is small. I have access to every media app that I currently use and they all work flawlessly. I have not used this device for gaming so I will not comment on that feature. One problem that really irritates me is that if you want to avoid accidentally purchasing titles, you have only one choice. You must set a parental control feature that will ask for a pin before you make purchases-but also before you watch free titles and make ANY changes to settings. The drawbacks outweigh the benefits in that regard, so I will be forced to watch out for titles that aren't free. This wouldn't be a problem except that when you search from the menu, with voice or not, you will not be brought immediately to where that title is free. For example, I accidentally bought House of Cards because I clicked too fast when I searched- assuming it would bring me to the free Netflix version. It instead made me purchase the $3.00 episode. Note, Kindle Fire TV will direct you titles that ARE available on HBO Go, Showtime Anytime, and Prime- just not Netflix.Pros:-Processing power/ graphics card allow for Full HD and 5.1 surround sound.-HBO Go, Showtime Anytime, Netflix, and Pandora.-Ability to use your phone as a remote.-Cloud allows you to upload your photos, music, and videos.Cons:-Sleep/Off button oddly inaccessible.-Can't prevent unauthorized purchases without activating full parental controls- Amazon wants you to purchase titles you may not have planned to.-Device and remote collect fingerprints easily.-Voice will only work for amazon, in Netflix for example it will not search Netflix specific titles.
